title: Arpeggio: Major 7th in E (Shape: G)

# Arpeggio: Major 7th in E (Shape: G)

An arpeggio is the playing of the individual notes of a chord in succession, rather than simultaneously. In this case, we will focus on the Major 7th Arpeggio in the key of E, played in the G shape.

## Notes and Intervals:

- E (Root)
- G# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- D# (Major 7th)
  
This arpeggio gives you a lush and jazzy sound because of the Major 7th interval, adding a sophisticated and colorful tone to your playing.

## Genre and Musical Flavor:

The Major 7th arpeggio is often used in genres like jazz, soul, and some forms of pop. It infuses a sense of sophistication and elegance to the music and can create a dreamy or contemplative mood, making it a favorite tool for musicians looking to add a touch of class to their compositions.

## Songs:

1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra** - This jazz standard prominently features major 7th chords and arpeggios, creating a smooth and romantic atmosphere.

2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - The Major 7th arpeggio is subtly used throughout the song, adding a sense of melancholy and introspection to the music.

3. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder** - This classic by Stevie Wonder showcases major 7th chords and arpeggios, contributing to the joyful and soulful vibe of the song.
